page.title: 16RECREATION
page.content: {Chelford}has facilities for bowls, cricket,hockey,football and fishing. Near the A537/A535 junction is the ground of the Chelford Cricket Club, members coming from a large area.It has a Junior tournament which is becoming nationally famous.On the same site is a disused Hockey pitch.Near the Parish Hall is a playing field with goal posts,although there is no local football team.Behind the Dixon Arms is a bowling green used by the Chelford Bowling Club which plays friendly matches.Astle Lake is used by the Altrincham Angling Club which has recently dredged and re-stocked it. There are a few footpaths in the block and these are used by hikers. Horse riding is also a popular pastime and there are a number of bridlepaths in use. The A537 is often used for bicycling trials and races.
